span.a: You are currently on this page - COVID-19 UPDATES & FAQ

span.span: SCHOOL DISTRICT OF AMERY
Dear Warrior Families,

strong.span:
The School District of Amery understands that parents and guardians may have questions about the education experience of their child(ren) during this period of school closure. Found below are answers to many of the frequently asked questions.
Additional information specific to distance learning can also be found on the
Thank you for your continued patience and flexibility as the School District of Amery seeks to partner with you to provide the best possible school experience during school closure.
If you have questions about the information found here please contact the District Office at 715-268-9771 extension 272 or

span.strong: CLASS OF 2020 SENIOR PLANS: GRADUATION & MORE

strong.span: YEAR-END COMPUTER DROPOFF & PERSONAL BELONGING PICKUP SCHEDULE

span.strong: DISTANCE LEARNING HUB FOR PARENTS & STUDENTS

strong.a:
TALKING TO CHILDREN ABOUT COVID-19:
A Parent Resource

span.span: How long will school be closed?

The School District of Amery has been under a state-mandated school closure since Wednesday, March 18, 2020. The newest mandate from Governor Tony Evers has all schools closed through the end of the school year. School buildings are closed until June 30, 2020.
The last day of school will be Friday, May 22. Instructional materials will be provided through this date.
What is the best way to contact a teacher or staff member?

Please contact school staff via email whenever possible. All staff email addresses can be found on the Staff tab of the district website. You may call the District as well, but please be prepared to leave a voice mail message since most staff are working off-campus at this time.
Will students move to their next grade in the school year 2020-2021?

All students will move to their next grade in the school year 2020-2021. Students will not be required to re-do the grade they are presently in due to the mandated school closure. Amery staff will work with our students to account for the learning which they may miss in March, April, May and June of the present school year. The goal in providing instructional materials to your child(ren) during school closure is to minimize the amount of material which will need to be learned next school year.
Are parents and students allowed on campus during the closure?

Parents and students are not allowed in school buildings during the state-mandated school closure unless during designated meal and schoolwork pickup times. All playgrounds are closed. Families may use the outdoor facilities of the District as long as social distancing guidelines are followed.
Is Clubhouse Childcare open?

The safety of our children and Clubhouse staff are top priority, and therefore, Clubhouse childcare is closed through June. Clubhouse childcare remains open for the children of healthcare workers by recommendation of the Wisconsin Department of Children and Families.
Will we have to go to school in the summer to make up missed days?

We will not be required to make up the days which will be missed due to the mandated school cancellation. The Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction will grant waivers for its requirement of instructional minutes for the 2019-2020 school year.

strong.span: Are school meals available during the school closure?

span.span: Yes. The School District of Amery recognizes that there are families who depend on us for some of their nutritional needs. The Amery School Nutrition department will provide free breakfast and lunch meal pickup for children 18 years of age and younger who reside in the School District of Amery.
Meal pickup is ONCE PER WEEK at the Middle School on Mondays between 11:15 a.m. and 1:15 p.m. OR between 4:00 and 6:00 p.m. This pickup will include 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches per child.

Meal pickup will continue through June 29. If Summer School resumes in July, the pickup program will end, and meals will instead be available at school. If Summer School is unable to resume in July, we will continue the weekly meal pickup.
You must sign up in advance to receive meals. Online signup and additional information can be found HERE.
If you are signed up and want to be removed from the meal list, or if you have questions, please email nelsons@amerysd.k12.wi.us

span.strong: When can I get items from my child's desk, locker and/or gym locker?

span.span: Student items can be picked up at the same time that computers and school-issued books and materials are returned to school during the week of May 25. A schedule is HERE. In order to keep everyone safe and to provide for the organized return and pickup, it is essential that you follow this SCHEDULE.
How can parents and guardians be ensured that their child(ren) will learn the material which is necessary for their present grade level in March, April, May and June?

Materials are being provided to your child(ren) on a daily or weekly basis depending upon their learning platform (virtual or hard copy). All of these materials are aligned with the state of Wisconsin standards for instruction and further are deemed the essential standards which should be learned. The School District of Amery is confident that your child(ren) will receive the necessary instruction which will have them prepared for next school year.
Additional information for parents is available on the Distance Learning Hub.
How will my child(ren) be graded for the work they complete during the school closure?

Elementary and Intermediate School students will be evaluated by classroom teachers on progress made towards a mastery of essential standards. The way your child(ren) will be graded will be communicated with you by the elementary school and intermediate school.
Middle school students will also be evaluated for their mastery of essential standards by their instructors. These students will receive a pass/fail grade for their coursework.
High school students will receive a letter grade for their work and academic credit if the letter grade is a passing mark.

span.strong: How are students with an IEP and/or a 504 being supported during the closure?

span.span: The School District of Amery will provide educational opportunities to all of our students with disabilities.
Special education staff will continue to offer support to students per their Individualized Education Plan (IEP) to the greatest extent possible during this public health emergency.
Parents and guardians are to remain in contact with the case manager(s) for their child(ren) to ensure that instruction is being received in an equitable manner.
If you have questions about special education services for your child during cancellation please contact Brad Baumgartner, Director of Pupil Services, at
Additional information about Pupil Services resources can be found HERE.
Why are only high school, middle school and some intermediate school children using devices to receive their instruction?

The decision regarding who uses devices to receive their instruction is a product of the number of devices available, the availability of internet services in households, the nature of the material being learned and the development ability of the student. These factors have determined the present landscape of learning in the School District of Amery. Please remember how sudden the decision to close schools was and how quickly the District needed to put together a plan for off-site learning.

span.strong: What is the expectation that the School District of Amery has for the education of students while they are learning from home?

span.span: The expectation for students is that they will complete the materials which have been provided to the best of their ability. Further, it is the hope that parents can, where and when possible, provide assistance to their children while they are completing this work. The goal for all students is to avoid a backslide in their educational preparedness as we move into next school year.

At the middle and high school levels it is necessary for students to complete these instructional materials in order to receive a passing grade for coursework. Further, at the high school students are required to complete this work in order to receive academic credit. The ability to graduate is determined by the credits that a student earns in their high school career.
Is technical support available for school laptop/device questions?

Much of the instruction at the middle and high schools will take place with the use of school laptops. With technology can come technological problems. If your child(ren) experience problems with their school laptops, please fill out a support ticket by logging into this site https://amery.incidentiq.com with your childs Google username and password, or you can email the IT Department at IT@amerysd.k12.wi.us.
When will school laptops and devices be returned to school?

p.span: All school-issued computers will need to be returned to school the week of Monday, May 25th. A schedule for the return of school computers is HERE. In order to keep everyone safe and to provide for the organized return of school-issued computers it is essential that you follow this SCHEDULE.

span.span: What is the status of school events, co-curricular activities and athletic events?
Any activities scheduled on a day that school is closed are cancelled. All co-curricular activities have been suspended indefinitely.
The Wisconsin Interscholastic Athletic Association (WIAA) has cancelled the spring sports season. All athletic fees which have been paid for spring sports will be refunded.

span.strong: Will there be summer school this summer?

span.span: The June session of summer school has been cancelled. June sessions of summer school have been moved into July. The summer school schedule will be as follows:
Swimming Session #1: July 1, 3, 6, 8-10
Session A: July 13-17
Session B: July 20-24
Session C: July 27-31
Session D: August 3-7
Session E: August 10-14
Swimming - Session #2: August 3-6, 10-13

span.strong: Has the Amery High School Prom been cancelled?

span.span: Unfortunately, yes. Prom is cancelled.

span.strong: Will Senior Awards Night go on as scheduled?

span.span: Amery High School will host Senior Awards Night on Wednesday, May 13th as a virtual experience. All students who have been chosen as a scholarship recipient will be recognized on this evening. The event will be live streamed on the We Are Amery Facebook page.
View the Senior Plans HERE

span.strong: What are the plans for Graduation?

span.span: The 2020 Amery High School graduation ceremony has been rescheduled for Thursday, July 16th at 7:00 p.m. There may be limited attendance for this event based on the recommendations from the Wisconsin Department of Health. More information on graduation will be made available in early June. Graduation will be live streamed for those who are not able to be in attendance.
View the Senior Plans HERE

span.strong: What about Driver's Education behind-the-wheel training?

span.span: Drivers Education behind-the-wheel training is postponed until further notice. Anyone who has already paid and would like to explore other options may receive a full refund. We will make an announcement when behind-the-wheel resumes.
June classroom driver's education will be offered online. July classes will hopefully be offered in the classroom setting.

span.strong: Will students be required to take state-mandated standardized assessments when they return to school this spring or next fall?

span.span: All standardized testing for the state of Wisconsin in the school year 2019-2020 has been cancelled. By mandate of the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction (DPI) there will not be any additional standardized testing for our students even if schools resume before the end of the school year.

span.strong: Will Advanced Placement (AP) testing be happening?

span.span: Advanced Placement (AP) testing will proceed forward on these scheduled dates from the College Board. The format for testing has been modified for testing at home. For more information on AP testing please go to: www.collegeboard.org
